titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Purnell W. Choppin papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA151
titlestmt.author: TJ

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-11-01 14:52:44 -0400.

change.item: Imported into the Archivistsâ€™ Toolkit by Aurexus and Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Purnell W. Choppin papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Purnell W. Choppin (1929- ) an animal virologist, came to Rockefeller University and hospital in 1957 under a fellowship from the National Foundation. For twenty eight years Dr. Choppin's research was primarily concerned with the influenza and parainfluenza viruses. His papers consist of lab notebooks, reports, minutes of meetings, printed materials, lectures, memoranda and correspondence. In 1970 he was appointed professor and senior physician and served as vice president for academic program (1983).
Choppin was born on July 4, 1929 in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, and attended Louisiana State University where he received an M.D. degree from its School of Medicine in 1953.

Professor Choppin served in an advisory capacity to several scientific organizations; the NIAID's influenza Commision, Markey Scholars Program and as chairman of the Virology Study Section of the National Institute of Health.
In 1983 Dr. Choppin received the Howard Taylor Rickett Award of the University of Chicago. He also served as Chairman of the Virology Department at the Howard Hughes Institute in New York.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in 3 series:

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: correspondence, notes, meeting and workshop material, applications, brochures, and grant information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 1 and Series 2 are arranged in alphabetical order then in chronological order within subjects.
